alert.note: Alert for McLean; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 30 at 5:45PM CDT until April 30 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR EASTERN WOODFORD AND NORTHWESTERN MCLEAN COUNTIES... At 544 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Danvers, or 10 miles west of Bloomington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported a 67 mph wind gust in Stanford at 541 pm. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Carlock, Normal, Hudson and Gridley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 39 between mile markers 3 and 22. Interstate 74 between mile markers 117 and 126. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
